entry.title: Websites that help you relaxing and be more productive at learning.
entry.content:
Sometime you find your self not productive in learning stuff, other time you can not relaxing? You are in the right place, to day I introduce you to some websites that help you in relaxing and much more, make you more productive in learning!

  1. brain.fm
    Brain.fm is a really great website to make you productive in learning. Just sign up! Login and play musics that brain.fm provied.There are ‘Focus’, ‘Relax’ and ‘Sleep’ musics that you can play, that are really effective on what they intented to do! There are a pro version that will give you more feautures like offline access, but for me the free version if nice enough! So that is brain.fm
  1. Pocket
    Pocket is a ‘watch later’ button for your browser and your time. If you see an interesting website but you need to do something first. Just press the ‘Poket’ button and Pocket will save that website to your lists. After done looking at the website, remove it!. It help you save time searching in your browser’s history!
    Make you do what you need to done first, so that is Pocket!
  1. Evernote
    As you may know, Evernote is on of the most popular talking note thingy. But not so many of you know that Evernote have a web-app. Evernote is not just a note-talking website. It is also a life saver. For me it is a productivity suite! It save me lots of hours. And if you use my link, you will have 3 months pro! So that is Evernote.

Thanks for reading everyone!

entry.title: My FREE Data Science and Machine Learning Master’s Degree!
entry.content:
Hi everyone! This is my first blog post sooooooooooo yay. The reason why I want to write this is because I want to learn Data Science and Machine Learning and have experienced with some part of it! Ok so let get started!

The basics, everyone need to start somewhere:
  1. Harvard’s CS50 Course (Intro to computer science.)
  2. Intro to programming (A cut-down version of the Nanodegree. But for me that is enough cause you also doing the CS50 course!)
Now for some algorithms!, important!
  1. Algorithms on KhanAcademy (great course!)
  2. Data Structures & Algorithms in Python (for some data scutures)

The basics will take about 1 - 2 months

Now for some maths :
  1. Linear algebra - Khan Academy
  2. Calculus - Khan Academy
  3. Multivariable calculus - Khan Academy
  4. Statistics and probability - Khan Academy
  5. Vectors - Khan Academy
  6. Matrices

That is all for maths. There are technologies that remove the math part but you need to learn math to know the core. Technologies change, math stay the same!

Ok, so you have done math and are the basics of computer science. Now we will have the basics of Data Science and Machine Learning!

Data Science Track:
  1. Introduction to Data Science
  2. Intro to Inferential Statistics (you have learn statistics before, now for some inferential statistics)
  3. Intro to Descriptive Statistics (for more statistics!)
  4. Intro to Data Analysis
  5. SQ: for Data Analysis
  6. Data Wrangling with MongoDB
  7. Data Visualization and D3.js
Machine Learning:
  1. Intro to Machine Learning
  2. Deep Learning
  3. fast.ai

I will keep this up to date so make sure to go back and check, there will be lots of still coming. This bot the complete version yet cause I am on vacation right now. If you like this post then make sure to upvote this. If you think something need to change then just press that ‘request edit’ button. Thanks for reading!
